p: MDA is formed during oxidative degeneration and is considered an indicator of lipid peroxidation. SOD is an important free radical scavenger that acts via multiple mechanisms to prevent damage from reactive O 2 â€“. The results showed that compared to the BC group, the ox-LDL group exhibited a dramatic increase in MDA levels and a decrease in intracellular SOD enzyme activity; this increase in MDA levels was reversed by treatment with both NHJ and SHJ, with the effect increasing as the NHJ or SHJ dose increased. These results also showed that the decrease in MDA levels and the elevation of SOD activity were more efficient in HUVECs treated with NHJ compared to HUVECs treated with SHJ ( Figure 3).
